a.title: Honor Roll / Students of the Month

li.a: Honor Roll / Students of the Month

span.style: font-size: x-large; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
font-size: x-large;

font-size: large; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: large; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.strong: Attention Students and Parents in Grades 8-11: You MUST check your email regarding 20-21 scheduling. Mrs. Smith has sent first draft schedules along with posting videos. This needs to be done ASAP.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

div.p: We hope everybody had an enjoyable holiday! Touching base with family and friends keeps us all grounded and looking forward to the day we can all be back together. Here are some quick updates for this week:

ul.li: The school building is still closed through May 1. Online learning will continue until further notice. Packet Pickup/Drop Off resumes this Friday, April 17. Look for the red totes.

3rd quarter grades are accessible through Progressbook. You can check these anytime and it's a good way to keep track of what is graded for the 4th nine weeks. Remember, grades for this last nine weeks will count toward athletic eligibility this fall. Don't fall behind!!!
Depending on what Governor DeWine, we have chose some alternative dates for graduation. These are all tentaive and will begin at 7:00pm: Saturday, May 23; Thursday, June 18; Thursday, July 16

div.p: We couldn't be prouder of our teachers and "home teachers" during this time! As always, if you have any questions, please call the office or email. Continue staying safe and take care!!

span.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.strong: 4/2/20 - Red Cross In Need of Help

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The American Red Cross is looking for local volunteers throughout Ohio that would be willing to help at blood drives and local disasters. In addition, we are also looking for 'HELP FROM HOME" volunteers to help with volunteer support. All required training and resources will be provided. For more info, send an email to volunteerohio@redcross.org or visit our volunteer website at www.redcross.org/volunteer ....

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Blood Donors are also needed in every area - visit redcrossblood.org to find the closest donation site near you to schedule an appointment! Thanks in advance for your consideration..

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

strong.span: 3rd Quarter grades are now available on Progressbook. No paper grade cards will be printed due to the shutdown. Please contact Sandy Thomas at thomass@vanlueschool.org if you need assistance.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.strong: Red totes have been placed on the steps to the old building labeled "Turn In" and "Drop Off" on Fridays only. Totes will be available until 7pm tonight. We want the students to continue working on materials to keep them in "school mode." This isn't an ideal situation for anybody and we are doing the best we can with the resources available t o us. We appreciate EVERYBODY pulling together during this time and we look forward to the day when we are all back together.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.strong: Please view this short presentation for instructions to access Google Classroom.

div.span: Today we celebrated our February Students of the Month!!

p.strong: 2/18/20 - Kindergarten Registration and Screening - Postponed Date TBA

div.p: If your child will be five (5) years of age by August 1, 2020 and you plan to enroll him/her in Kindergarten, PLEASE COMPLETE THE FORM BELOW AND RETURN IT TO VANLUE SCHOOL NO LATER THAN WEDNESDAY, MARCH 11, 2020. Screening will be here at Vanlue on Wednesday, March 25, 2020. Please register your child as soon as possible. March 25 is the only day we will hold kindergarten screening for the 2020-2021 school year. Screening information and details will be mailed to those who register. A residential parent MUST accompany the child to the screening. An original birth certificate, shot records, social security card, and any custody papers need to be brought to the screening.

p.a: Click here for the screening form

div.p: Click the link below if you are interested in obatining an 2019-2020 All Sports Pass or a specific season pass. Contact Jeremy Kloepfer with any questions.

p.a: Click here for the pass application

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

p.span: The report below is given to us by the Hancock County ESC as they must provide all participating school districts in the Hancock County Business Advisory Council by March 1, 2019 since the ESC serves as our designee for fulfilling this O.R.C. requirement.

div.p: The links listed below will provide information regarding our State Report Card. Please feel fee to contact the school if you have any questions.
